newsitem.title: CHINA: China's B share indices mixed, A indices rebound.
newsitem.headline: China's B share indices mixed, A indices rebound.

text.p: China's B share indices closed mixed on Thursday with institutions staying on the sidelines, while the A share markets rebounded after losses in the previous session, brokers said.
Shanghai's B share index edged down 0.082 points or 0.13 percent to 60.779 points, while the Shenzhen B share index inched up 0.47 points or 0.33 percent to end at 140.74 points.
Shanghai brokers said the B share index closed down on poor sentiment on rumours that concrete measures will soon be announced to force domestic investors out of the market.
"Most institutions were seen cutting their positions to avoid risk given the uncertainties," one broker said.
Real estate developer Shanghai Jinqiao was the biggest loser on concerns about its results, falling $0.020 or 4.16 percent to $0.460.
Newcomer clothing maker Shanghai Kaikai was the most active share rising $0.012 or 3.94 percent to $0.316, mostly on institutional support.
On Shenzhen's B share market, trading was dull with most institutions unwilling to engage in large-scale trading in the absence of market-moving news, brokers said.
"Counters likely to post healthy 1996 results will become relatively strong performers in the run-up to the corporate annual report season," a Shenzhen-based broker said.
Dadonghai, the best B share performer, rose HK$0.11 or 3.15 percent to HK$3.60 on the day's heaviest trade of 2.90 million shares on institutional buying, brokers said.
The A share market in both Shanghai and Shenzhen rose on a technical rebound but trading remained sluggish with market sentiment cautious, brokers said.
Shanghai's A index rose 11.391 points or 1.22 percent to 947.042 points, while the Shenzhen A share index added 3.89 points or 1.18 percent to close at 333.63 points.
In Shanghai, clothing maker Kansai was the star on institutional demand, jumping 10 percent to its limit-up of 17.17 yuan.
In Shenzhen, property concern Shenzhen Fountain was the biggest gainer, surging 0.91 yuan to its 10 percent limit-up of 9.96 yuan on speculative buying, brokers said.
